comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I click on a newgroup that downloaded more unread messages than the upper subjects window had room for.


Actual results:

Windwos XP SP3 and Thunderbird 5.0.

Newgroups.  View set for Unread.  Sort set for date ascending.  Threaded view. 

t's a bit intermittent, but in general, when I fetch new messages from my news server AND there is more new messages than will fit in the top window (the message headers), instead of auto scrolling to the first (by date) unread message, it usually scrolls to the last message. Even sometimes to the middle unread message.  But generally never the first unread message.  That forces me to have to scroll the headers window to get back to the first unread message almost every time.



Expected results:

When selecting an newsgroup with unread messages, the message header (subjects) window should scroll to the first unread message after a fresh download of new messages.

comments.text:
This is what I see using Thunderbird 91.2.1 on Windows 10.

My default setting for all messages is Sort By > Order Received > Ascending > Threaded.

Selected each newsgroup in my Usenet-News account and set each to View > Threads > Unread.
Got new messages and the last message was at the bottom of the Thread pane of the selected group. I checked all four groups.
No message was selected and displayed in the Message pane.
Pressed the N key, and it went to the first unread message in the Thread pane, displaying it in the Message Pane.

I would conclude that I am viewing unread threads as configured.

My default is to View > Threads > All, and I select Unread in the Quick Filter.
